verses.text_plain: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
verses.verse_html: 1Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

verses.text_plain: How long will it be ere ye make an end of words? mark, and afterwards we will speak.
verses.verse_html: 2How long will it be ere ye make an end of words? mark, and afterwards we will speak.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore are we counted as beasts, and reputed vile in your sight?
verses.verse_html: 3Wherefore are we counted as beasts, and reputed vile in your sight?

verses.text_plain: He teareth himself in his anger: shall the earth be forsaken for thee? and shall the rock be removed out of his place?
verses.verse_html:
4He teareth himself in his anger: shall the earth be forsaken for thee? and shall the rock be removed out of his place? ▼
▼ himself: Heb. his soul

tokens.text: for thee? and shall the rock

footnotes.body_html: ▼ himself: Heb. his soul

verses.text_plain: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.
verses.verse_html: 5Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.

verses.text_plain: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.
verses.verse_html:
6The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him. ▼
▼ candle: or, lamp

verses.text_plain: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.
verses.verse_html: 7The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.

verses.text_plain: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon a snare.
verses.verse_html: 8For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon a snare.

verses.text_plain: The gin shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.
verses.verse_html: 9The gin shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.

verses.text_plain: The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.
verses.verse_html:
10The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way. ▼
▼ laid: Heb. hidden

verses.text_plain: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and shall drive him to his feet.
verses.verse_html:
11Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and shall drive him to his feet. ▼
▼ drive: Heb. scatter

verses.text_plain: His strength shall be hungerbitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.
verses.verse_html: 12His strength shall be hungerbitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.

verses.text_plain: It shall devour the strength of his skin: even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength.
verses.verse_html:
13It shall devour the strength of his skin: even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength. ▼
▼ strength: Heb. bars

verses.text_plain: His confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.
verses.verse_html: 14His confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.

verses.text_plain: It shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his: brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
verses.verse_html: 15It shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his: brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.

verses.text_plain: His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.
verses.verse_html: 16His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.

verses.text_plain: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.
verses.verse_html: 17His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.

tokens.text: and he shall have no name

verses.text_plain: He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.
verses.verse_html:
18He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world. ▼
▼ He…: Heb. They shall drive him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ He…: Heb. They shall drive him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ He…: Heb. They shall drive him

verses.text_plain: He shall neither have son nor nephew among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.
verses.verse_html: 19He shall neither have son nor nephew among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.

verses.text_plain: They that come after him shall be astonied at his day, as they that went before were affrighted.
verses.verse_html:
20They that come after him shall be astonied at his day, as they that went before were affrighted. ▼
▼ went…: or, lived with him
 , ▼
▼ were…: Heb. laid hold on horror

footnotes.body_html: ▼ went…: or, lived with him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ were…: Heb. laid hold on horror
footnotes.body_html: ▼ were…: Heb. laid hold on horror

verses.text_plain: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
verses.verse_html: 21Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
